sentences.english: When Sin claps his broad wings over the battle.
sentences.chinese: 當罪惡煽動巨翼在戰鬥中肆虐。

sentences.english: The reason for this, of course, was the fierce battle that was raging in Gaza.
sentences.chinese: 箇中緣由，自是肆虐加沙地帶的激戰。

sentences.english: Fire and wind raged all around, snapping juniper trees and incinerating the sagebrush.
sentences.chinese: 四周風火肆虐，猛咬着杜松樹，把山艾樹燒成了灰燼。

sentences.english: The wind was whipping waves of sleet across the pond.
sentences.chinese: 寒風捲着雨夾雪，在池塘上肆虐。

sentences.english: Heavy snow wreaks havoc in northwest China, destroying livestock and blocking roads. Michaela Cabrera reports.
sentences.chinese: 大雪肆虐中國西北部，凍死大量牲畜，阻塞了道路。
季夏是蚊子肆虐的時候。

sentences.english: Even so, a recession is under way.
sentences.chinese: 即使這樣，衰退正四下肆虐。

sentences.english: They conquered a wilderness full of mutant beasts to arrive at the top of their food chain.
sentences.chinese: 他們征服了變異獸肆虐的荒野，踏上食物鏈的頂端。

sentences.english: I understand, beyond the surf beating barranca.
sentences.chinese: 在海浪肆虐的峭壁上，我明白了。

sentences.english: Above was an angry sky, from which rain fell and in which lightning played.
sentences.chinese: 大山之上是怒吼的天空，大雨滂沱，雷電肆虐。

sentences.english: Hundreds of black holes are, it seems, roaming our galaxy and swallowing up whatever gets in their way.
sentences.chinese: 無數的黑洞正竄遊於我們銀河吞噬肆虐一切。

sentences.english: Within these areas are huge storm systems that have raged for years.
sentences.chinese: 在這些區域裏，有着肆虐多年巨大的風暴系統。

sentences.english: It is a big cat that hunts in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 它是一隻大型的貓科動物，在叢林裏奔跑肆虐。

sentences.english: Yet the CFCs already in the air are still doing their dirty work.
sentences.chinese: 但是空氣中現有的氟利昂製冷劑還在繼續肆虐。

sentences.english: Businesses shut down and water-borne diseases spread.
sentences.chinese: 商鋪關張，水媒傳染病肆虐。

sentences.english: A tornado rips across the Missouri Plains.
sentences.chinese: 龍捲風在密蘇里平原肆虐橫行。

definition: to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
lit. hiding the sky and covering the earth (idiom); fig. earth-shattering/omnipresent/of universal importance
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
